TopicTitle: Wasn't there a file with the science multipliers for each planet ?

Articles.Content:
A long time a go I fancied Removing the multiplier for all other planets/moons in the game.
I seem to remember there was a file where all these multipliers were stored, and it could be easily edited.
(Case and point, imagine all other places beside Kerbin only having the x1 multiplier, so a Temperature scan is always 8 science points, no matter if on Eeloo or on the Mun).

Well... I can't find it anymore.  I found the ScienceDefs.cfg but that only gives the base number so it's not what I want.
Also, I don't want to reduce the science gains from the menu, as this affects Kerbin as well, and will not make it the way I want.

Kind of preparing my 1.8 campaign, I thought it was a good time as any to change it.
If anybody can help, just give me a line.
I have never heard of such a file, but you can use kittopia tech to export the planet(s) and create a patch using kopernicus that edits each one specifically, but other than that I got nothing.

Celestial Body Science Editor: Download Version 12.0

 

Edited December 28, 2019 by zer0Kerbal

Both your ideas are good ideas.
For now I'm going to go with the .cfg file from DMagic's "Celestial_Body_Science_Editor-12.0"

It's pretty much exactly what I wanted. Thanks !
Next paythru I'm going to have to Science the S*** out of planets... without nerfing the Kerbin biomes.
